curriculum.title: SIGNALIS: A Deep Dive into Philosophical Horror and Dystopian Narrative - A Critical Media Analysis Curriculum
curriculum.executive_overview: This curriculum transforms a comprehensive video game analysis into an intellectual journey through dystopian literature, psychological theory, and philosophical concepts. Using the video essay as a gateway, students will explore George Orwell's totalitarian themes, Carl Jung's psychological theories, Nietzsche's eternal recurrence, and Robert Chambers' weird fiction. The video serves not merely as gaming commentary but as applied cultural criticism, demonstrating how contemporary media engages with classical philosophical and literary traditions. Students will examine how the video analyst applies theoretical frameworks to decode narrative meaning, moving from accessible media analysis to rigorous academic theory.

daily_modules.title: Introduction: Video Games as Cultural Texts

knowledge_benchmark.understand: How video games function as cultural texts worthy of serious analysis
knowledge_benchmark.explain: The methodology of treating interactive media as literature
knowledge_benchmark.recognize: Techniques of close reading applied to visual and interactive narratives
knowledge_benchmark.connect: Gaming analysis to broader traditions of cultural criticism
knowledge_benchmark.awareness: The legitimacy of pop culture as intellectual subject matter

core_concepts: Popular culture as legitimate academic subject
daily_modules.pre_viewing_primer: Watch how the analyst treats every detail as meaningful. Note the methodology of extracting intellectual content from gaming mechanics and visual design. Observe how the video establishes gaming as a legitimate subject for serious analysis.
daily_modules.primary_reading_focus: Understanding how contemporary media criticism applies traditional analytical frameworks to new forms

supplementary_readings.title: Nineteen Eighty-Four
supplementary_readings.author: George Orwell
supplementary_readings.focus: Introduction to totalitarian themes and state surveillance concepts that will appear throughout the video

key_insights: Video games can function as complex cultural texts
Intellectual analysis can be applied to any cultural form
Visual and interactive elements carry theoretical weight
Gaming criticism bridges accessibility with academic rigor
daily_modules.post_viewing_synthesis: How does the video establish its analytical credibility? What makes this approach to gaming analysis intellectually legitimate? Consider how the analyst transforms plot description into cultural criticism.

daily_modules.title: Orwellian Control: Language, Surveillance, and Social Engineering

knowledge_benchmark.understand: Orwell's theories of language manipulation and social control
knowledge_benchmark.explain: How totalitarian states use language to shape reality
knowledge_benchmark.recognize: Techniques of dehumanization and control in both fiction and reality
knowledge_benchmark.connect: Gaming mechanics to real-world surveillance and control systems
knowledge_benchmark.awareness: The political implications of linguistic and technological control

daily_modules.pre_viewing_primer: Watch how the analyst identifies Orwellian themes in the game's mechanics. Note how language restrictions, surveillance, and social hierarchy function as both game elements and political commentary.
daily_modules.primary_reading_focus: Orwell's theories of how language shapes reality and enables social control

supplementary_readings.title: Nineteen Eighty-Four
supplementary_readings.author: George Orwell
supplementary_readings.focus: Newspeak, doublethink, and the Ministry of Truth - how totalitarian states control reality through language

key_insights: Language control enables thought control
Surveillance creates self-regulating behavior
Dehumanizing language enables oppression
Gaming mechanics can model political systems
daily_modules.post_viewing_synthesis: How does the video demonstrate Orwellian concepts through gaming analysis? What makes the game's approach to these themes particularly effective? Consider how interactive media might communicate political ideas differently than literature.

daily_modules.title: Jungian Psychology: Collective Unconscious and Archetypal Narrative

knowledge_benchmark.understand: Jung's theories of collective unconscious, archetypes, and synchronicity
knowledge_benchmark.explain: How Jungian concepts manifest in narrative and character psychology
knowledge_benchmark.recognize: Archetypal patterns and synchronistic events in storytelling
knowledge_benchmark.connect: Individual psychology to collective human experience
knowledge_benchmark.awareness: The influence of Jungian theory on modern narrative and culture

daily_modules.pre_viewing_primer: Watch how the analyst applies Jungian concepts to explain the game's psychological mechanics. Note how collective memories, archetypal imagery, and synchronistic events function both as gameplay elements and psychological theory.
daily_modules.primary_reading_focus: Jung's foundational concepts of how individual psychology connects to universal human patterns

supplementary_readings.title: The Archetypes and the Collective Unconscious
supplementary_readings.author: Carl Jung
supplementary_readings.focus: Core concepts of collective unconscious, archetypes, and how they manifest in human experience and culture

key_insights: Individual experiences connect to universal patterns
Synchronicity suggests meaningful connections beyond causality
Archetypes appear across cultures and narratives
Gaming can model psychological processes
daily_modules.post_viewing_synthesis: How does the video use Jungian theory to explain narrative events? What makes the psychological interpretation compelling? Consider how gaming might uniquely express psychological concepts through interactivity.

daily_modules.title: Nietzschean Philosophy: Eternal Recurrence and Existential Loops

knowledge_benchmark.understand: Nietzsche's concepts of eternal recurrence, will to power, and self-overcoming
knowledge_benchmark.explain: How cyclical time relates to existential philosophy and meaning-making
knowledge_benchmark.recognize: Nietzschean themes in narrative structure and character development
knowledge_benchmark.connect: Gaming loops to philosophical concepts of repetition and transcendence
knowledge_benchmark.awareness: The influence of Nietzschean thought on modern existential philosophy

daily_modules.pre_viewing_primer: Watch how the analyst connects the game's looping structure to Nietzschean philosophy. Note how repetition functions both as game mechanic and philosophical concept.
daily_modules.primary_reading_focus: Nietzsche's exploration of how we might live if everything recurred eternally

supplementary_readings.title: Thus Spoke Zarathustra
supplementary_readings.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
supplementary_readings.focus: Eternal recurrence, will to power, and the concept of self-overcoming through cyclical existence

key_insights: Eternal recurrence as a test of life's value
Repetition can lead to either despair or transcendence
Gaming loops model existential concepts
Cyclical narratives explore philosophical themes
daily_modules.post_viewing_synthesis: How does the video use Nietzschean philosophy to explain the game's structure? What makes the eternal recurrence concept relevant to interactive media? Consider how repetition in gaming might uniquely express existential themes.

daily_modules.title: Weird Fiction and Cosmic Horror: The King in Yellow Tradition

knowledge_benchmark.understand: The weird fiction tradition and its philosophical implications
knowledge_benchmark.explain: How cosmic horror expresses existential themes about knowledge and reality
knowledge_benchmark.recognize: Techniques of weird fiction and their cultural significance
knowledge_benchmark.connect: Horror literature to philosophical questions about reality and knowledge
knowledge_benchmark.awareness: The intellectual tradition behind modern horror and weird fiction

core_concepts: The dangers and power of forbidden knowledge
daily_modules.pre_viewing_primer: Watch how the analyst traces the intellectual tradition behind horror references. Note how weird fiction functions as philosophy rather than mere entertainment.
daily_modules.primary_reading_focus: Chambers' exploration of art, madness, and the limits of human knowledge

supplementary_readings.title: The King in Yellow
supplementary_readings.author: Robert W. Chambers
supplementary_readings.focus: The original weird fiction exploring themes of decadent art, madness, and reality breakdown

key_insights: Horror literature can express philosophical ideas
Weird fiction explores limits of knowledge and reality
Art and literature can be 'dangerous' to conventional thinking
Gaming inherits intellectual traditions from literature
daily_modules.post_viewing_synthesis: How does the video connect weird fiction to intellectual themes? What makes this literary tradition philosophically significant? Consider how gaming might continue or transform weird fiction traditions.

daily_modules.title: Theoretical Synthesis: Culture, Media, and Philosophical Analysis

knowledge_benchmark.understand: How cultural criticism integrates multiple theoretical frameworks
knowledge_benchmark.explain: The methodology of serious media analysis and cultural interpretation
knowledge_benchmark.recognize: How contemporary media engages with classical philosophical traditions
knowledge_benchmark.connect: Different theoretical approaches into coherent cultural analysis
knowledge_benchmark.awareness: The role of cultural criticism in understanding modern media and society

daily_modules.pre_viewing_primer: Watch how the analyst synthesizes multiple theoretical frameworks into comprehensive cultural analysis. Note how different philosophical and psychological approaches complement each other.
daily_modules.primary_reading_focus: Understanding how cultural criticism operates as intellectual methodology

supplementary_readings.title: The Archetypes and the Collective Unconscious
supplementary_readings.author: Carl Jung
supplementary_readings.focus: Review of synchronicity and archetypal concepts for synthesis with other frameworks

key_insights: Multiple theoretical frameworks can illuminate different aspects of culture
Cultural criticism requires interdisciplinary thinking
Contemporary media continues classical intellectual traditions
Serious analysis can be applied to any cultural form
daily_modules.post_viewing_synthesis: How does the video demonstrate effective cultural criticism? What makes the integration of multiple theoretical approaches successful? Consider how you might apply similar analytical frameworks to other cultural texts.

daily_modules.title: Critical Application: Developing Analytical Frameworks

knowledge_benchmark.understand: How to construct comprehensive analytical frameworks for cultural texts
knowledge_benchmark.explain: The process of developing original cultural criticism and analysis
knowledge_benchmark.recognize: Opportunities for applying theoretical frameworks to contemporary media
knowledge_benchmark.connect: Academic theory to practical cultural analysis and criticism
knowledge_benchmark.awareness: The ongoing relevance of philosophical and psychological theory to cultural understanding

daily_modules.pre_viewing_primer: Watch how the analyst concludes with broader implications about cultural analysis and theoretical application. Note how the specific analysis opens to general methodological insights.
daily_modules.primary_reading_focus: Developing your own approach to cultural criticism and analysis

supplementary_readings.title: Thus Spoke Zarathustra
supplementary_readings.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
supplementary_readings.focus: Review of eternal recurrence themes for final synthesis

key_insights: Cultural criticism requires both theoretical knowledge and analytical skill
Popular culture offers rich material for serious intellectual engagement
Analytical frameworks can be applied across different cultural texts
Cultural analysis connects individual works to broader human concerns
daily_modules.post_viewing_synthesis: What analytical techniques from this video could you apply to other cultural texts? How might you develop your own approach to cultural criticism? Consider how this methodology might be applied to films, literature, or other games.

knowledge_framework.foundational_concepts: The curriculum establishes cultural criticism as legitimate intellectual practice, demonstrates how contemporary media engages with classical philosophical traditions, and provides frameworks for analyzing any cultural text through multiple theoretical lenses.
knowledge_framework.advanced_applications: Students develop skills in interdisciplinary analysis, learn to connect abstract theory to concrete cultural examples, and gain ability to construct original analytical frameworks for cultural texts.
knowledge_framework.synthesis_goals: By completion, students should ability to approach any cultural text with serious analytical tools, understand how popular culture continues intellectual traditions, and develop original cultural criticism using integrated theoretical approaches.

supplementary_books.title: The Archetypes and the Collective Unconscious
supplementary_books.author: Carl Jung

academic_papers.title: Behind the Black Mirror: The Limits of Orwellian Dystopia
Jung's Conceptualization of Synchronicity Theory and the Role of Astrology
A Jaundiced View of America: Robert W. Chambers and The King in Yellow

resource_requirements.equipment_needed: Computer/device for video viewing, note-taking materials, access to books and academic papers
